Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the basic principles, theories, and methods of contemporary psychology, including the study of human diversity.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the basic principles, theories, and methods of contemporary psychology, including the study of human diversity. Honors-level content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Psychology majors only. Research findings, theory, models and techniques of academic counseling and career advising.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: What it means to be a psychology major, career opportunities upon graduation, and different graduate school paths.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PSY 2012 and PSY 3023 and Psychology BS major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Focuses on developing employability and taking steps toward individual career goals, in Psychology.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PSY 2012, and either STA 2014 or STA 2023; or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Standard scores, confidence intervals, sampling distributions, hypothesis testing, correlation and regression as applied to research in psychology.

PSY3204K - Honors Statistical Methods in.name: PSY3204K - Honors Statistical Methods in Psychology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Standard scores, confidence intervals, sampling distributions, hypothesis testing, correlation and regression as applied to research in psychology. With Honors content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PSY 2012 , PSY 3204C, and either  STA 2014C  or  STA 2023 .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Investigation of experimental designs and research methods utilized in psychology. Laboratory outcomes will be statistically analyzed and reported in APA format.

Course Description.text: Investigation of experimental designs and research methods utilized in psychology. Laboratory outcomes will be statistically analyzed and reported in APA format. With Honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the theory underlying psychological tests and measurements procedures, including reliability, validity, and item analysis.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Sampling methods, questionnaire construction, and interpretation of results.

PSY3625 - Science and Pseudoscience in P.name: PSY3625 - Science and Pseudoscience in Psychology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Critically evaluates fringe-science, paranormal, and otherwise unusual beliefs about human behavior. Scientific methodology is used to evaluate bizarre claims such as ESP, astrology, voodoo, mind control, and alien abduction.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PSY 2012 and Psychology major, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Psychological aspects of human relationships with animals.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Directed Independent Study

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Placement in a community agency for supervised experience in applications of psychology to community problems.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Discussion of the psychological perspectives on art to gain a greater understanding and enhanced appreciation for the process and products of creativity.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: PSB 3002 and PSY 3213C and PSY 4604, and Psychology Major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Refresh and apply knowledge in core areas of psychology to cutting edge research in applied disciplines.

Course Description.text: The scientific study of positive human experiences.

PSY4942 - Instructional Experiences in U.name: PSY4942 - Instructional Experiences in Undergraduate Psychology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Prepares undergraduate students to more effectively learn psychology concepts by facilitating learning in variety of university psychology classrooms and labs.
